meanings.sent1: The car looked sleeker after it was polished.
meanings.sent2: The new phone design is sleeker than the previous model.
meanings.sent3: The sleeker car caught everyone's attention at the show.
meanings.sent4: Her sleeker hair shone in the sunlight like a polished gem.
meanings.sent5: The sleeker dress hugged her figure perfectly, making her stand out.

meanings.definition: To make something smoother or more polished.
meanings.sent1: She used a cloth to sleeker the surface of the table.
meanings.sent2: He decided to sleeker the floors before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to sleeker the sauce by adding more butter.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes sleeker the painting to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The car wash will sleeker your vehicle to a shiny finish.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is sleek in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sleeker of the two cars won the race.
meanings.sent2: She admired the sleeker of the two dresses in the store.
meanings.sent3: The sleeker of the two models strutted confidently on the runway.
meanings.sent4: The sleeker of the two smartphones was more popular among users.
meanings.sent5: The sleeker of the two buildings stood out in the city skyline.
